explains: adj. 深红色的；（脸）通红的
v. （尤指因尴尬）（脸）变红；（使）深红

sentences.en: Aunt Polly blushed crimson with humiliation, and frowned and shook her head at Tom.
sentences.cn: 波莉姨妈羞得满脸通红，对汤姆又是皱眉又是摇头。

sentences.en: Breeches of crimson velvet, silk stockings, and low, silver-buckled slippers completed his costume.
sentences.cn: 一条深红色的丝绒马裤、一对丝袜和一双银扣拖鞋构成了他的装束。

sentences.en: Their halberd staves were covered with crimson velvet, fastened with gilt nails, and ornamented with gold tassels.
sentences.cn: 他们的戟柄覆盖着深红色的天鹅绒，用镀金的钉子钉牢，并饰以金色的流苏。
